exceptions.exn: In environment ps : primestream n, m : nat H : divides (ps n) (ps m) Unable to unify "ps n = ps m" with "n = m".
In environment ps : primestream n, m : nat H : divides (ps n) (ps m) H0 : nat Unable to unify "nat" with "n = m".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
ps: primestream
m: nat
n: nat

Goal:
divides (ps n) (ps m) -> n = m

Premises:
Record primestream : Set := Build_primestream { str : nat -> nat; str_inj : forall n m : nat, str n = str m -> n = m; str_prime : forall n : nat, prime (str n) } Arguments Build_primestream (_ _ _)%function_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
divides = fun n k : nat => exists p : nat, k = p * n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments divides (_ _)%nat_scope
Znat.Nat2Z.inj_add : forall n m : nat, BinInt.Z.of_nat (n + m) = BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.of_nat n) (BinInt.Z.of_nat m)
Znat.Nat2Z.inj_mul : forall n m : nat, BinInt.Z.of_nat (n * m) = BinInt.Z.mul (BinInt.Z.of_nat n) (BinInt.Z.of_nat m)
Znat.Nat2Z.inj_sub_max : forall n m : nat, BinInt.Z.of_nat (n - m) = BinInt.Z.max BinNums.Z0 (BinInt.Z.sub (BinInt.Z.of_nat n) (BinInt.Z.of_nat m))
Znat.Nat2Z.inj_lt : forall n m : nat, n < m < -> BinInt.Z.lt (BinInt.Z.of_nat n) (BinInt.Z.of_nat m)
Znat.Nat2Z.inj_le : forall n m : nat, n <= m < -> BinInt.Z.le (BinInt.Z.of_nat n) (BinInt.Z.of_nat m)
Build_primestream : forall str : nat -> nat, (forall n m : nat, str n = str m -> n = m) -> (forall n : nat, prime (str n)) -> primestream
divides_fact : forall m p : nat, 1 < p <= m -> divides p (fact m)
BinIntDef.Z.sub = fun m n : BinNums.Z => BinIntDef.Z.add m (BinIntDef.Z.opp n) : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.sub (_ _)%Z_scope
BinInt.Z.mul_nonneg_nonneg : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 n -> BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 m -> BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 (BinInt.Z.mul n m)
Nat.add_succ_r : forall n m : nat, n + S m = S (n + m)
Nat.add_succ_l : forall n m : nat, S n + m = S (n + m)
divides_bool_spec : forall n p : nat, divides_bool (S n) p = true < -> divides (S n) p
divides_bool_spec' : forall n p : nat, divides_bool (S n) p = false < -> ~ divides (S n) p
Nat.mul_sub_distr_r : forall n m p : nat, (n - m) * p = n * p - m * p
Nat.mul_add_distr_r : forall n m p : nat, (n + m) * p = n * p + m * p
binomial.divides_n_fact_n : forall n : nat, 0 < n -> divides n (binomial.fact n)
Nat.eq_mul_1_nonneg' : forall n m : nat, 0 <= m -> n * m = 1 -> n = 1 /\ m = 1
Nat.eq_mul_1_nonneg : forall n m : nat, 0 <= n -> n * m = 1 -> n = 1 /\ m = 1
bezout_sc : forall p q a b m : nat, a * p + b * q = 1 + m -> divides p m \/ divides q m -> is_gcd p q 1
ZifyClasses.mkapp2 : forall (S1 S2 S3 T : Type) (Op : S1 -> S2 -> S3) (I1 : S1 -> T) (I2 : S2 -> T) (I3 : S3 -> T) (TBOP : T -> T -> T), (forall (n : S1) (m : S2), I3 (Op n m) = TBOP (I1 n) (I2 m)) -> forall (s1 : S1) (t1 : T), I1 s1 = t1 -> forall (s2 : S2) (t2 : T), I2 s2 = t2 -> I3 (Op s1 s2) = TBOP t1 t2
binomial.divides_fact : forall n i : nat, 0 < i <= n -> divides i (binomial.fact n)
modS_divide : forall n p : nat, p mod S n = 0 < -> divides (S n) p
Nat.eq_add_1 : forall n m : nat, n + m = 1 -> n = 1 /\ m = 0 \/ n = 0 /\ m = 1
bounded_search : forall (m : nat) (P : nat -> Type), (forall n : nat, n < m -> P n + (P n -> False)) -> {n : nat & ((n < m) * P n)%type} + {forall n : nat, n < m -> P n -> False}
ZifyClasses.mkrel : forall (S T : Type) (R : S -> S -> Prop) (I : S -> T) (TR : T -> T -> Prop), (forall n m : S, R n m <-> TR (I n) (I m)) -> forall (s1 : S) (t1 : T), I s1 = t1 -> forall (s2 : S) (t2 : T), I s2 = t2 -> R s1 s2 < -> TR t1 t2
str_inj : forall (p : primestream) (n m : nat), p n = p m -> n = m
Znat.Nat2Z.inj_succ : forall n : nat, BinInt.Z.of_nat (S n) = BinInt.Z.succ (BinInt.Z.of_nat n)
prime_algo : forall p : nat, prime p < -> p = 2 \/ 3 <= p /\ ~ divides 2 p /\ (forall n : nat, 3 + 2 * n < p -> ~ divides (3 + 2 * n) p)
Nat.mul_cancel_r : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> n * p = m * p < -> n = m
Nat.mul_cancel_l : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> p * n = p * m < -> n = m
nat_rev_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, (forall n : nat, P (S n) -> P n) -> forall x y : nat, x <= y -> P y -> P x
min_dec : forall P : nat -> Prop, (forall n : nat, {P n} + {~ P n}) -> (exists n : nat, P n) -> {m : nat | P m /\ (forall x : nat, P x -> m <= x)}
divides_anti : forall x y : nat, divides x y -> divides y x -> x = y
ZifyClasses.mkapp : forall (S1 S2 T : Type) (OP : S1 -> S2) (I1 : S1 -> T) (I2 : S2 -> T) (TUOP : T -> T), (forall n : S1, I2 (OP n) = TUOP (I1 n)) -> forall (s1 : S1) (t1 : T), I1 s1 = t1 -> I2 (OP s1) = TUOP t1
power_factor_uniq : forall p i j x y : nat, p <> 0 -> ~ divides p x -> ~ divides p y -> p ^ i * x = p ^ j * y -> i = j /\ x = y
is_lcm = fun p q r : nat => divides p r /\ divides q r /\ (forall k : nat, divides p k -> divides q k -> divides r k) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_lcm (_ _ _)%nat_scope
is_gcd = fun p q r : nat => divides r p /\ divides r q /\ (forall k : nat, divides k p -> divides k q -> divides k r) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
binomial.divides_fact_S : forall n : nat, divides (binomial.fact n) (binomial.fact (S n))
Nat.add_sub_assoc : forall n m p : nat, p <= m -> n + (m - p) = n + m - p
BinIntDef.Z.max = fun n m : BinNums.Z => match BinIntDef.Z.compare n m with | Lt => m | _ => n end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.max (_ _)%Z_scope
```intros ps m n H. apply (str_inj ps (ps n) (ps m)). exact H.```

original: intros ps m n H. apply (str_inj ps (ps n) (ps m)). apply H.
